required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Vitoss With and Without BMA for Benign Cavitary Lesions
clinical_study.official_title: A Combined Retrospective and Prospective Protocol to Evaluate Vitoss With and Without Bone Marrow Aspirate for Benign Cavitary Lesions

brief_summary.textblock: This is a retrospective, two-arm study reviewing the healing of cavitary defects in patients treated with Vitoss alone versus those treated with Vitoss with bone marrow aspirate (BMA). There will be a prospective follow-up visit at 24+ months to evaluate lont-term healing in patients identified during the retrospective portion of the study. It is thought that the inclusion of BMA will facilitate the resorption of the graft material, leading to better long-term bone healing.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Vitoss resorption into the native bone as observed via CT
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of Vitoss resorption into the native bone will be retrospectively recorded in the Case Report Form at the 6 week, 3, 6, 12 and 18 month timepoints based on review of x-rays as well.

secondary_outcome.measure: Presence of graft within the soft tissue as observed by CT
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of the graft within the soft tissue will be retrospectively recorded in the Case Report Form at the 6 week, 3, 6, 12 and 18 month timepoints based on review of x-rays as well.

secondary_outcome.measure: Presence of a rim of radiolucency surrounding the grafted defect as observed by CT
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of a rim of radiolucency surrounding the grafted defect will be retrospectively recorded in the Case Report Form at the 6 week, 3, 6, 12 and 18 month timepoints based on review of x-rays as well.

secondary_outcome.measure: Size of the defect as observed by CT
secondary_outcome.description: The size of the defect will be retrospectively recorded in the Case Report Form at the 6 week, 3, 6, 12 and 18 month timepoints based on review of x-rays as well.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bone trabeculation through the defect as observed by CT
secondary_outcome.description: Bone trabeculation through the defect will be retrospectively recorded in the Case Report Form at the 6 week, 3, 6, 12 and 18 month timepoints based on review of x-rays as well.

secondary_outcome.measure: Persistence of graft material through the lesion as observed by CT
secondary_outcome.description: Persistence of graft material through the lesion will be retrospectively recorded in the Case Report Form at the 6 week, 3, 6, 12 and 18 month timepoints based on review of x-rays as well.

arm_group.description: Patients with a benign bone lesion of the extremity or pelvis for which surgical curettage age was recommended and who received Vitoss bone graft with BMA to fill the cavity.
Patients with a benign bone lesion of the extremity or pelvis for which surgical curettage was recommended and who received Vitoss bone graft to fill the cavity.

intervention.description: Vitoss is a synthetic calcium-based bone void filler made of beta-tricalcium phosphate.

study_pop.textblock: Patients will be selected from retrospective records from the investigators specialty practice.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- males and females >/= 18 years of age at the time of surgery
- Patients treated with Vitoss alone or Vitoss with added BMA between 2004 and 2012
- willing and able to provide Informed Consent to participate in and follow study requirements (including a radiologic assessment)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a known post-traumatic defect
- active infection at the time of implantation
- history of bone marrow disorders
- contraindications to the use of supplemental BMA

overall_official.affiliation: State University of New York - Upstate Medical University
